### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.

- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Modules with about topics are unable to be found if the help is delivered via `Update-Help`.

```powershell
Update-Help PSReadline
Get-Help about_PSReadline
```

### Expected behavior

```console
Shows about topic
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Get-Help about_PSReadline

Name                              Category  Module                    Synopsis
----                              --------  ------                    --------
Add-History                       Cmdlet    Microsoft.PowerShell.Core Appends entries to the session history.
Clear-History                     Cmdlet    Microsoft.PowerShell.Core Deletes entries from the PowerShell session comm…
Get-History                       Cmdlet    Microsoft.PowerShell.Core Gets a list of the commands entered during the c…
Invoke-History                    Cmdlet    Microsoft.PowerShell.Core Runs commands from the session history.
about_Functions_Argument_Complet… HelpFile
about_History                     HelpFile
about_Line_Editing                HelpFile
about_Pipelines                   HelpFile
about_Tab_Expansion               HelpFile
```

comments.author: StevenBucher98
comments.body: This repros in 7.2.6 too, @sdwheeler and @daxian-dbw is there something with the `about_PSReadLine` page that is mis-linked? or is this have to do with `Get-Help`?

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body:
This is a bug in `Get-Help`. On my system I get the following output:

```powershell
PS> get-help about_PSReadLine

Name                              Category  Module                    Synopsis
----                              --------  ------                    --------
about_psreadline                  HelpFile
about_PSReadLine                  HelpFile
```

The help system is seeing two files. I believe that one is from Windows PowerShell 5.1 and the other is the current version of help installed for PowerShell 7.x.

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body:
There are actually 2 different issues here: Thomas's issue and mine.

I think Thomas's issue is the classic known issue for PSReadLine caused by the change in the spelling (capital L). Also you must use `Update-Help -Force` to ensure that it downloads any files. See https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/updating-help-for-the-psreadline-module-in-windows-powershell-5-1/ for instructions to fix.

My issue is that I had two about_PSReadLine files installed on my system and `Get-Help` only displays the summary view when there is more than one help topic available. This is expected behavior for `Get-Help`. The question is how did I get two copies of that file? Deleting the old (lowercase) file fixed my problem.

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body:
@sdwheeler In my testing this issue isn't limited to PSReadLine, its just the one I chose for the example.

Here is another example from my module:

```powershell
Install-PSResource AnyPackage
Update-Help AnyPackage -Verbose
Get-Help about_AnyPackage
```

It doesn't return anything however if you copy the en-US folder to the module directory it can find it. It looks Get-Help doesn't search the `Help\<module>\<version>\<culture>` directory for about topics, it does work for the maml help though.

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body: @ThomasNieto I can't reproduce your issue. Can you provide exact steps with real module names. Be sure to run `Update-Help <module> -Force`.

@ThomasNieto OK, I can reproduce this problem.

@adityapatwardhan This is the problem we discussed where help is not found for a module installed in the user scope unless you manually copy the help to the module folder.
